pull.title: 0.15.2 release notes, manpage and version bump
pull.body: Semi manual based on [commits since v0.15.1](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/v0.15.1...0.15), so please sanity check.

events.body: Some sort of Travis permission error?
Removed translation credits, because they weren't updated for this release.
That Travis builder is botched both for 0.16 and 0.15 for some reason (already checked that there are no caches, so don't think that's it), that's safe to ignore.
I think it'd make sense to combine this with #14263 and a bump-version commit

doc: Update manpages for 0.15.2

issue.title: Update manpages for 0.15.2
issue.body:
I used the generator script from master and fixed the version number after running the script.

Notable changes:
* script verification threads changed from 6 to 4
* maximum BIP141 block weight default changed from 3000000 to 3996000
* blockmaxsize deprecated

events.body:
* updated pull request numbers to reference originals rather than the backport. This is especially useful for #11647 which was one backport PR multiple PR's
* added missing authors @fanquake pointed out
* added RPC and Tests category
* added a version update commit
* moved manpage commit from #14263

From the manpage PR:
> I used the generator script from master and fixed the version number after running the script.
>
> Notable changes:
> * script verification threads changed from 6 to 4
> * maximum BIP141 block weight default changed from 3000000 to 3996000
> * blockmaxsize deprecated

rename.to: 0.15.2 release notes, manpage and version bump

events.body:
ACK 391b2cf0250de44afcaeaaf977e3ef8ec5c4d55f

Thank you for doing this!

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -62,15 +62,53 @@ frequently tested on them.
 Notable changes
 ===============
 
-0.15.x Change log
+Denial-of-Service vulnerability CVE-2018-17144
+-------------------------------
+
+A denial-of-service vulnerability exploitable by miners has been discovered in
+Bitcoin Core versions 0.14.0 up to 0.16.2. It is recommended to upgrade any of
+the vulnerable versions to 0.15.2 or 0.16.3 as soon as possible.
+
+0.15.2 Change log
 =================
 
+### Build system
+
+- #13093 `1618c63` depends: Fix Qt build with XCode 9.2 and 9.3 (fanquake)
+- #13574 `9fd3e00` depends: Update Qt download url (fanquake)
+- #12032 `cb7ef31` Make boost::multi_index comparators const
+
+### Consensus
+- #14247 `4b8a3f5` Fix crash bug with duplicate inputs within a transaction (TheBlueMatt, sdaftuar)
+ 
+### Wallet
+- #11647 `7af2457` contrib/init: Update openrc-run filename (Luke Dashjr)
+- #11647 `3f1db56` Wrap dumpwallet warning and note scripts aren't dumped (MeshCollider)
+- #11647 `42ea47d` Add wallet backup text to import*, add* and dumpwallet RPCs (MeshCollider)
+- #11647 `3a6cdd4` Add test for multiwallet batch RPC calls (Russell Yanofsky)
+- #11647 `1c8c7f8` Add missing batch rpc calls to python coverage logs (Russell Yanofsky)
+- #11647 `1036c43` Add missing multiwallet rpc calls to python coverage logs (Russell Yanofsky)
+- #11647 `2eea279` Make AuthServiceProxy._batch method usable (Russell Yanofsky)
+- #11647 `305f768` Limit AuthServiceProxyWrapper.__getattr__ wrapping (Russell Yanofsky)
comments.body:
Do you mean:
```
- #11647 `2eea279` Make AuthServiceProxy.\_batch method usable (Russell Yanofsky)
- #11647 `305f768` Limit AuthServiceProxyWrapper.\_\_getattr\_\_ wrapping (Russell Yanofsky)
```

comments.body: #11662 is a backport of #11554 from TheBlueMatt
